info.title: Mastodon microblogging
info.description: Mastodon is a decentralized GNU Social-compatible microblogging network made up of independent servers organized around specific themes, topics, or interests.

get.description: Get a view of the public timeline
View public statuses containing the given hashtag.

post.description: Publish a status with the given parameters.

get.description: Notifications concerning the user. This API returns Link headers containing links to the next/previous page. However, the links can also be constructed dynamically using query params and id values.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of results to return. Defaults to 20.

parameters.name: min_id
parameters.description: Return results immediately newer than ID

parameters.name: exclude_types
parameters.description: Array of types to exclude (follow, favourite, reblog, mention, poll, follow_request)

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: Return only notifications received from this account

Account.description: Represents a user of Mastodon and their associated profile.

username.description: The username of the account, not including domain.

acct.description: The Webfinger account URI. Equal to `username` for local users, or `username@domain` for

url.description: The location of the user's profile page. (HTTPS URL)

avatar.description: An image icon that is shown next to statuses and in the profile. The format is URL.

avatar_static.description: A static version of the avatar. Equal to `avatar` if its value is a static image; different if `avatar` is an animated GIF. The format is URL.

header.description: An image banner that is shown above the profile and in profile cards. The format is URL.

header_static.description: A static version of the header. Equal to `header` if its value is a static image; different if `header` is an animated GIF. The format is URL.

locked.description: Whether the account manually approves follow requests.

emojis.description: Custom emoji entities to be used when rendering the profile. If none, an empty array will be returned.

discoverable.description: Whether the account has opted into discovery features such as the profile directory.

last_status_at.description: When the most recent status was posted.

statuses_count.description: How many statuses are attached to this account.

followers_count.description: The reported followers of this profile.

following_count.description: The reported follows of this profile.

fields.description: Additional metadata attached to a profile as name-value pairs.

bot.description: A presentational flag. Indicates that the account may perform automated actions, may not be monitored, or identifies as a robot.

suspended.description: An extra entity returned when an account is suspended.

mute_expires_at.description: When a timed mute will expire, if applicable. ISO 8601 Datetime.

Activity.description: Represents a weekly bucket of instance activity.

week.description: Midnight at the first day of the week.  (UNIX Timestamp).

statuses.description: Statuses created since the week began, String (cast from an integer).

logins.description: User logins since the week began, String (cast from an integer).

registrations.description: User registrations since the week began, String (cast from an integer).

AdminAccount.description: Admin-level information about a given account.

id.description: The ID of the account in the database. Cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number.

created_at.description: When the account was first discovered.

email.description: The email address associated with the account.

ip.description: The IP address last used to login to this account.

locale.description: The locale of the account. ISO 639 Part 1 two-letter language code.

role.description: The current role of the account. Enumerable oneOf.

confirmed.description: Whether the account has confirmed their email address.

approved.description: Whether the account is currently approved.

disabled.description: Whether the account is currently disabled.

silenced.description: Whether the account is currently silenced.

suspended.description: Whether the account is currently suspended.

created_by_application_id.description: The ID of the application that created this account. Cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number.

invited_by_account_id.description: The ID of the account that invited this user. Cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number.

AdminReport.description: Admin-level information about a filed report.

id.description: The ID of the report in the database. Cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number.

action_taken.description: The action taken to resolve this report. Enumerable oneOf.

created_at.description: The time the report was filed.

updated_at.description: The time of last action on this report.

statuses.description: Statuses attached to the report, for context.

Announcement.description: Represents an announcement set by an administrator.

id.description: The announcement id. Cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number.

published.description: Whether the announcement is currently active.

all_day.description: Whether the announcement has a start/end time.

updated_at.description: When the announcement was last updated. ISO 8601 Datetime.

read.description: Whether the announcement has been read by the user.

scheduled_at.description: When the future announcement was scheduled. ISO 8601 Datetime.

starts_at.description: When the future announcement will start. ISO 8601 Datetime.

ends_at.description: When the future announcement will end. ISO 8601 Datetime.

AnnouncementReaction.description: Represents an emoji reaction to an Announcement.

name.description: The emoji used for the reaction. Either a unicode emoji, or a custom emoji's shortcode.

count.description: The total number of users who have added this reaction.

me.description: Whether the authorized user has added this reaction to the announcement.

url.description: A link to the custom emoji (URL).

static_url.description: A link to a non-animated version of the custom emoji (URL).

Application.description: Represents an application that interfaces with the REST API to access accounts or post statuses.

website.description: The website associated with your application. Must be URL.

vapid_key.description: Used for Push Streaming API. Returned with [POST /api/v1/apps](https://docs.joinmastodon.org/methods/apps/#create-an-application). Equivalent to [PushSubscription#server_key](https://docs.joinmastodon.org/entities/pushsubscription/#server_key)

client_id.description: Client ID key, to be used for obtaining OAuth tokens

client_secret.description: Client secret key, to be used for obtaining OAuth tokens

Attachment.description: Represents a file or media attachment that can be added to a status.

id.description: The ID of the attachment in the database. Cast from an integer but not guaranteed to be a number

url.description: The location of the original full-size attachment.

preview_url.description: The location of a scaled-down preview of the attachment.

remote_url.description: The location of the full-size original attachment on the remote website. String or null if the attachment is local.

description.description: Alternate text that describes what is in the media attachment, to be used for the visually impaired or when media attachments do not load.

blurhash.description: A hash computed by the [BlurHash algorithm](https://github.com/woltapp/blurhash), for generating colorful preview thumbnails when media has not been downloaded yet.

Card.description: Represents a rich preview card that is generated using OpenGraph tags from a URL.

type.description: The type of the preview card. String (Enumerable, oneOf).

author_name.description: The author of the original resource.

author_url.description: A link to the author of the original resource.

provider_name.description: The provider of the original resource.

provider_url.description: A link to the provider of the original resource.

html.description: HTML to be used for generating the preview card.

blurhash.description: A hash computed by the [BlurHash algorithm](https://github.com/woltapp/blurhash), for generating colorful preview thumbnails when media has not been downloaded yet.

Context.description: Represents the tree around a given status. Used for reconstructing threads of statuses.

Conversation.description: Represents a conversation with "direct message" visibility.

id.description: Local database ID of the conversation. Cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number

unread.description: Is the conversation currently marked as unread?

shortcode.description: The name of the custom emoji.

url.description: A link to the custom emoji. The format is URL.

static_url.description: A link to a static copy of the custom emoji. The format is URL.

visible_in_picker.description: Whether this Emoji should be visible in the picker or unlisted.

category.description: Used for sorting custom emoji in the picker.

FeaturedTag.description: Represents a hashtag that is featured on a profile.

id.description: The internal ID of the featured tag in the database. Cast from integer but not guaranteed to be a number

name.description: The name of the hashtag being featured.

url.description: A link to all statuses by a user that contain this hashtag.

statuses_count.description: The number of authored statuses containing this hashtag.

last_status_at.description: The timestamp of the last authored status containing this hashtag. ISO 8601 Datetime.

Field.description: Represents a profile field as a name-value pair with optional verification.

name.description: The key of a given field's key-value pair.

value.description: The value associated with the `name` key.

verified_at.description: Timestamp of when the server verified a URL value for a rel="me‚Äù link. If `value` is a verified URL. Otherwise, null

Filter.description: Represents a user-defined filter for determining which statuses should not be shown to the user.

id.description: The ID of the filter in the database. Cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number.

context.description: The contexts in which the filter should be applied.

expires_at.description: When the filter should no longer be applied. ISO 8601 Datetime, or null if the filter does not expire

irreversible.description: Should matching entities in home and notifications be dropped by the server?

whole_word.description: Should the filter consider word boundaries?

History.description: Represents daily usage history of a hashtag.

day.description: UNIX timestamp on midnight of the given day.

uses.description: the counted usage of the tag within that day. Cast from an integer.

accounts.description: the total of accounts using the tag within that day. Cast from an integer.

IdentityProof.description: Represents a proof from an external identity provider.

provider.description: The name of the identity provider.

provider_username.description: The account owner's username on the identity provider's service.

profile_url.description: The account owner's profile URL on the identity provider.

proof_url.description: A link to a statement of identity proof, hosted by the identity provider.

updated_at.description: When the identity proof was last updated. ISO 8601 Datetime.

Instance.description: Represents the software instance of Mastodon running on this domain.

uri.description: The domain name of the instance.

description.description: Admin-defined description of the Mastodon site.

short_description.description: A shorter description defined by the admin.

email.description: An email that may be contacted for any inquiries.

version.description: The version of Mastodon installed on the instance.

languages.description: Primary languages of the website and its staff. ISO 639 Part 1-5 language codes.

urls.description: URLs of interest for clients apps.

stats.description: Statistics about how much information the instance contains.

List.description: Represents a list of some users that the authenticated user follows.

id.description: The internal database ID of the list. Cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number.

title.description: The user-defined title of the list.

replies_policy.description: The user-defined title of the list.

Marker.description: Represents the last read position within a user's timelines.

home.description: Information about the user's position in the home timeline.

notifications.description: Information about the user's position in their notifications.

last_read_id.description: The ID of the most recently viewed entity. Cast from integer but not guaranteed to be a number

updated_at.description: The timestamp of when the marker was set. ISO 8601 Datetime.

version.description: Used for locking to prevent write conflicts.

Mention.description: Represents a mention of a user within the content of a status.

id.description: The account id of the mentioned user. Cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number

username.description: The username of the mentioned user.

acct.description: The webfinger acct URI of the mentioned user. Equivalent to `username` for local users, or `username@domain` for remote users.

url.description: The location of the mentioned user's profile.

Notification.description: Represents a notification of an event relevant to the user.

id.description: The id of the notification in the database. Cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number.

type.description: The type of event that resulted in the notification.

created_at.description: The timestamp of the notification. ISO 8601 Datetime.

Poll.description: Represents a poll attached to a status.

id.description: The ID of the poll in the database. Cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number.

expires_at.description: When the poll ends. ISO 8601 Datetime, or null if the poll does not end.

multiple.description: Does the poll allow multiple-choice answers?

votes_count.description: How many votes have been received.

voters_count.description: How many unique accounts have voted on a multiple-choice poll. Number, or null if `multiple` is false.

voted.description: When called with a user token, has the authorized user voted? Boolean, or null if no current user

own_votes.description: When called with a user token, which options has the authorized user chosen? Contains an array of index values for `options`. Array of Number, or null if no current user

emojis.description: Custom emoji to be used for rendering poll options.

title.description: The text value of the poll option.

votes_count.description: The total number of received votes for this option.

posting:default:visibility.description: Default visibility for new posts. Equivalent to [Source#privacy](https://docs.joinmastodon.org/entities/source/#privacy).

posting:default:sensitive.description: Default sensitivity flag for new posts. Equivalent to [Source#sensitive](https://docs.joinmastodon.org/entities/source/#sensitive).

posting:default:language.description: Default language for new posts. Equivalent to [Source#language](https://docs.joinmastodon.org/entities/source/#language). ISO 639-1 language two-letter code, or null

reading:expand:media.description: Whether media attachments should be automatically displayed or blurred/hidden.

reading:expand:spoilers.description: Whether CWs should be expanded by default.

PushSubscription.description: Represents a subscription to the push streaming server.

id.description: The ID of the push subscription in the database. Cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number.

endpoint.description: Where push alerts will be sent to.

alerts.description: Which alerts should be delivered to the `endpoint`.

Relationship.description: Represents the relationship between accounts, such as following / blocking / muting / etc.

id.description: The account id. Cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number.

requested.description: Do you have a pending follow request for this user?

endorsed.description: Are you featuring this user on your profile?

followed_by.description: Are you followed by this user?

muting_notifications.description: Are you muting notifications from this user?

showing_reblogs.description: Are you receiving this user's boosts in your home timeline?

notifying.description: Have you enabled notifications for this user?

domain_blocking.description: Are you blocking this user's domain?

Report.description: Reports filed against users and/or statuses, to be taken action on by moderators.

Results.description: Represents the results of a search.

accounts.description: Accounts which match the given query.

statuses.description: Statuses which match the given query.

hashtags.description: Hashtags which match the given query.

ScheduledStatus.description: Represents a status that will be published at a future scheduled date.

id.description: ID of the scheduled status in the database. Cast from an integer, but not guaranteed to be a number.

scheduled_at.description: ID of the status in the database. ISO 8601 Datetime.

Source.description: Represents display or publishing preferences of user's own account. Returned as an additional entity when verifying and updated credentials, as an attribute of Account.

privacy.description: The default post privacy to be used for new statuses.

sensitive.description: Whether new statuses should be marked sensitive by default.

language.description: The default posting language for new statuses, ISO 639-1 language two-letter code.

follow_requests_count.description: The number of pending follow requests

StatusCollection.description: Represents a status posted by an account

Status.description: Represents a status posted by an account.

id.description: ID of the status in the database. Cast from an integer but not guaranteed to be a number.

uri.description: URI of the status used for federation.

created_at.description: The date when this status was created.

sensitive.description: Is this status marked as sensitive content?

spoiler_text.description: Subject or summary line, below which status content is collapsed until expanded.

media_attachments.description: Media that is attached to this status.

mentions.description: Mentions of users within the status content.

tags.description: Hashtags used within the status content.

emojis.description: Custom emoji to be used when rendering status content.

reblogs_count.description: How many boosts this status has received.

favourites_count.description: How many favourites this status has received.

replies_count.description: How many replies this status has received.

url.description: A link to the status's HTML representation.

in_reply_to_id.description: ID of the status being replied. Cast from an integer but not guaranteed to be a number.

in_reply_to_account_id.description: ID of the account being replied to.

language.description: Primary language of this status. ISO 639 Part 1 two-letter language code.

text.description: Plain-text source of a status. Returned instead of `content` when status is deleted, so the user may redraft from the source text without the client having to reverse-engineer the original text from the HTML content.

muted.description: Have you muted notifications for this status's conversation?

pinned.description: Have you pinned this status? Only appears if the status is pinnable.

Tag.description: Represents a hashtag used within the content of a status.

name.description: The value of the hashtag after the `#` sign.

url.description: A link to the hashtag on the instance.

Token.description: Represents an OAuth token used for authenticating with the API and performing actions.

access_token.description: An OAuth token to be used for authorization.

token_type.description: The OAuth token type. Mastodon uses `Bearer` tokens.

scope.description: The OAuth scopes granted by this token, space-separated.

created_at.description: When the token was generated. UNIX Timestamp.

statusParam.name: status

visibility.description: How shall the toot be listed

sensitive.description: Mark status and attached media as sensitive?

statusParam.x-ms-summary: The text content of the status

limitParam.name: limit
limitParam.description: Maximum number of results to return. Defaults to 20 statuses. Max 40 statuses.
